definition: to pick up bits/to collect scrap material/tidbits/gleanings (used as gossip)
to pick up/to collate or arrange/ten (banker's anti-fraud numeral)

zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither
random thoughts/(in book titles etc) impressions/jottings
"Dawn Blossoms Plucked at Dusk", a collection of autobiographical essays by Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅[Lu3 Xun4]
to pocket a lost article/(fig.) to correct others' errors/to remedy omissions (in a text etc)
to express/to give expression to/variant of 紓|纾[shu1]/to relieve
form of writing novels that comprise lots of poetry in the body of the text, popular in the Ming Dynasty
